trans-unit.source: list[-1] will retrieve the last element of the list without changing the list. list.pop() will retrieve the last element of the list, but it will mutate/change the original list. Usually, mutating the original list is not recommended.
trans-unit.target: list[-1] 将检索列表的最后一个元素而不更改列表。 list.pop() 将检索列表的最后一个元素，但它将更改/更改原始列表。通常，不建议更改原始列表。

trans-unit.source: lst[-1] is the best approach, but with general iterables, consider more_itertools.last:

trans-unit.source: A slice of a list returns a new list - so we can slice from -1 to the end if we are going to want the element in a new list:
trans-unit.target: 一个列表的分片会返回一个新的列表--所以我们可以从-1开始分片到最后,如果我们要在一个新的列表中的元素。

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, if, for some reason, you're looking for something less pythonic, you could use list[len(list)-1], assuming the list is not empty.
trans-unit.target: 另外，如果由于某种原因，您正在寻找一些不那么pythonic的东西，则可以使用 list[len(list)-1] ，假设列表不为空。

trans-unit.source: I wish Python had a function for first() and last() like Lisp does... it would get rid of a lot of unnecessary lambda functions.
trans-unit.target: 我希望Python有一个像Lisp那样的first()和last()函数...........这样就可以去掉很多不必要的lambda函数。

trans-unit.source: If you intend to do nothing with that list, this would be more apropos:
trans-unit.target: 如果你打算对那份名单什么都不做,那就更合适了。

trans-unit.source: If you're doing something more complicated, you may find it more performant to get the last element in slightly different ways.
trans-unit.target: 如果你在做一些比较复杂的事情,你可能会发现用稍微不同的方式来获取最后一个元素,会更有表现力。

trans-unit.source: If you're new to programming, you should avoid this section, because it couples otherwise semantically different parts of algorithms together. If you change your algorithm in one place, it may have an unintended impact on another line of code.
trans-unit.target: 如果你是编程新手,你应该避免这一部分,因为它将原本语义上不同的算法部分耦合在一起。如果你在一个地方改变了你的算法,可能会对另一行代码产生意想不到的影响。

trans-unit.source: If you're performing a complete iteration over the list already, the last element will still be referenced by the variable name assigned in the loop:
trans-unit.target: 如果你已经在列表中进行了完整的迭代,那么最后一个元素仍然会被循环中分配的变量名所引用。

trans-unit.source: If your str() or list() objects might end up being empty as so: astr = '' or alist = [], then you might want to use alist[-1:] instead of alist[-1] for object "sameness".
trans-unit.target: 如果您的 str() 或 list() 对象最终可能是空的： astr = '' 或 alist = [] ，则可能要对对象“ 使用 alist[-1:] 而不是 alist[-1] 相同”。

trans-unit.source: In Python, how do you get the last element of a list?
trans-unit.target: 在Python中,如何获取列表的最后一个元素?

trans-unit.source: In a function
trans-unit.target: 在一个函数中

trans-unit.source: In either case:
trans-unit.target: 在这两种情况下。

trans-unit.source: In fact, you can do much more with this syntax. The some_list[-n] syntax gets the nth-to-last element. So some_list[-1] gets the last element, some_list[-2] gets the second to last, etc, all the way down to some_list[-len(some_list)], which gives you the first element.
trans-unit.target: 实际上，您可以使用此语法做更多的事情。该 some_list[-n] 语法获取第n到最后一个元素。因此 some_list[-1] 获取最后一个元素， some_list[-2] 获取倒数第二个，依此类推，一直到 some_list[-len(some_list)] ，它为您提供了第一个元素。

trans-unit.source: Indexes and slices can take negative integers as arguments.
trans-unit.target: 索引和切片可以接受负整数作为参数。

trans-unit.source: It depends on what you want to do with your list because the pop() method will delete the last element.
trans-unit.target: 这取决于您要对列表执行的操作，因为 pop() 方法将删除最后一个元素。

trans-unit.source: Note that getting a list item by index will raise an IndexError if the expected item doesn't exist. This means that some_list[-1] will raise an exception if some_list is empty, because an empty list can't have a last element.
trans-unit.target: 请注意，如果预期的项目不存在， IndexError 索引获取列表项将引发IndexError。这意味着，如果 some_list 为空，则 some_list[-1] 将引发异常，因为空列表不能包含最后一个元素。

trans-unit.source: Ok, but what about common in almost every language way items[len(items) - 1]? This is IMO the easiest way to get last element, because it does not require anything pythonic knowledge.
trans-unit.target: 好的，但是在几乎每种语言方式中， items[len(items) - 1] 通用吗？这是IMO获得最后一个元素的最简单方法，因为它不需要任何Python知识。
